paper.title: Statistics on factoring polynomials mod p and p-adically
paper.abstract: A well-known way to factor a polynomial f over the integers is to factor it modulo some prime p and then use Henselu0027s method to refine the mod p factorization to an approximate p-adic one, i.e., one correct modulo a suitably high power of p. Any integral factor of f is the product of some subset of the irreducible p-adic factors, so the computation reduces to testing a finite number of trial factors. The number of trial factors depends exponentially on the number of p-adic factors, so the latter is critical to the efficiency of the method.
